REVIEW_BODY: Raffles City is a fine example of your well-run Asian mall in a central business district; sparking clean, good variety of shops (most of them higher end) eminently safe and with a killer food court. Were here every day for at least one meal and was pleased.

Raffles City Shopping Centre is pretty much like most of the other modern shopping malls in Singapore. It has an MTR Station down below and a decent food court and lots of shops including a Marks & Spencer and a Robinsons. The mall is also well situated being very close to several historical sites such as St, Andrew;s Cathedral, the Raffles Hotel, the War Memorial and the Padang, all of which are a short walk away.

Other stores here include Timberland, Rolex, Furla, Coach, Mango, Moje and Starbucks etc as well as so many others.

This used to be one of our favourite malls but a recent bad experience at a restaurant called Poulet in the food court has disappointed us. However, for people looking for a pleasant shopping experience then this is a nice mall to visit.

One thing to note is that during rush hour and whenever it is raining the Grab fare increases dramatically. We were staying in Balmoral Park just off Stevens Road and normally it costs around S$7 or S$8 for a ride between Raffles City and Balmoral Park, but at rush hour the fare quickly increases to around S$35 and above. So when the Grab prices increase at rush hour then it is better to take a normal taxi.

We wanted to have a look at the local brands but was pleasantly surprised to see so many western brands in the mall. It’s a huge mall and many places to eat and drink. We stopped for a pancake roll on the Lowe levels which was tasty.
Loved this mall, had a great variety of foods and shops with easy access to mrt lines and other malls via underground walkways. Lovely and clean. Has great bakery at basement.
You can easily find foods, drinks, many other shops as well as currency exchange office inside there! Just 1 minute from the Carlton hotel we stayed.

Raffles City is a huge mall. In fact it is like a mini city in itself.
Everything that you need is in this mall.

Raffles City connects three major hotels - one of which is the Fairmont Hotel. It has a MRT station. there are loads of shops, big and small. The biggest is Robinsons. There are many smaller shops selling anything and everything. There are also the bigger brand name shops too.

I lost track of the number of the eating places in Raffles City. There were so may to choose from - that it could take you quite a while deciding which one to eat at.

You could easily spend a whole day - and not notice the time passing by.

REVIEW_TITLE: If you want the Mall experience to go shopping, this is it
REVIEW_BODY: Raffles City is located strategically beside several hotels, in fact, it is integrated to the Fairmont Hotel, so dropping by to do some quick shopping or to grab a bite to eat is easy and efficient. Most of the restaurants are in the basement level, though there is a food park-style dining area at the 3rd level. Don't forget to pass by this mall if you are in the vicinity.

Raffles city shopping centre has everything. Shops, restaurants, food court, market place, cafes, bars, hotel, exhibits, mrt, and more. The hotel Swissotel The Stamford is in the same shopping complex. Many dining options. I like this place.
Really, shopping malls in Singapore is becoming a state of an art more than a financial practice. Expensive one though ;)

This mall has everything you can think of. From basement to top floor there is something that any fussy person could find.

We were shopping late at night and there were lots of people out shopping, eating and window shopping.

We did buy a few shoes, and clothes, prices are ok. About the same as Aust. Look for the specials, these are were you will get the bargains.

We stayed above the mall in the Stamford, so this was incredibly convenient. Lots of food choices including a well appointed supermarket with Waitrose and many US and international food items, including vegemite for Aussies. We spent lots of time here, as food is expensive in Singapore but affordable from the food outlets. Plenty of fashion, makeup and other specialty stores. Lots of ATMs also and links straight to the City Hall MRT.

Stopped here as was passing through. Has been done up significantly since I was last here. Has a good vibe and was very busy. As with many Singapore Malls being right above an MRT station makes it wonderfully convenient.

If you are looking to explore Singapore, there are a few hotels attached to this mall, namely, Swissotel Stamford & Fairmont. Located right below this mall is the MRT station which allow you to explore the rest of Singapore by subway. Lots of eateries at the basement.

REVIEW_TITLE: Central location and easy train access
REVIEW_BODY:
Lots of good food at every Budget. Shopping is good too anchored by the best department store in Singapore-Robinsons.

Easy access by multiple train lines.

Surrounding area provide many other options such as more shopping at Suntec City, the famous Raffles Hotel, South Beach, an old church.

Good place to spend a day.

The Raffles City shopping mall is mostly filled with high end designer labels. When you get to the basement of the mall, it is filled with supermarkets, bakeries, restaurants and convenience stores. As a guest of the nearby Swissotel, having these eating options was really beneficial to my stay.

There's something for everyone here. Many stores are "high end" like Kate Spade and Channel, but there are lots of other stores too. Please note that the people in Singapore are very petite. A size "2" American is a size 6 here! If you're an 8 or larger (American) you may have a hard time finding clothes. There's also plenty of places to eat upstairs and down. We stopped at the Coffee Club which was very good.
Passed through. Seemed a smart and well kept place with a good range of shops and restaurants. Was a short trip so did not have time to wonder

Very accessible mall. Lots of top class stuff, like Rolex watches. Good opportunity for top end window shopping, for example a Rolex worth $177,000!
Tip 1: not many cafe's on the ground floor but take the escalator down to the basement there are stacks of lunch bars and cafes, very reasonably priced.
Tip 2: just a 10 minute stroll down to Merlion Park
Lots of food at basement and a food court at third floor. Spoilt with choices . Loved Poulet roast chicken n Tuk Tuk cha Thai milk tea. Definitely a food heaven.

REVIEW_TITLE: Convenient Place for Shopping and Tea Break
REVIEW_BODY: This shopping place is located between Marina Bay and Orchard, MRT station is City Hall. The shop here is the classical one not like a mall. There are plenty of high street brands and cafes for area break.
wonderfull shopping mall .......... near to our hotel. with all the shops one needs ........... and good restaurants. very good is the foodcourt at reasonable prices.

Despite its smaller size compared to malls in Orchard or the huge Suntec City, the mall is almost perfect, as described below :

Pros :
+ Perfect Location, literally in the heart of City Hall area.
+ On Top of City Hall MRT (Red and Green limes) and also close to Esplanade MRT (Yellow line)
+ Has an underground pass that connect to Suntec City
+ Next to Carlton, Fairmont and Raffles Hotel as well as Chijmes and St Andrew's Cathedral
+ Tons of food choices in the basement, and food court on the upper level
+ Big Supermarket (Cold Storage chains) which is paramount for Traveller who stays couple of days

Cons :
- No major kids toys shop (eg. Toys R Us) nor major bookstore chains
- Should have an enclosed/dedicated smoking area, so smokers dont jams the entry location with nasty smokes
Another shopping centre in Singapore. The shops are not very cheapand I wouldn't recommend it for people on a budget. The food court downstairs is very good with a lot of different restaurants.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice shopping mall and food court
REVIEW_BODY:
Lots of stores for all ages, all tastes and almost any product.
The mall is modern, clean and actually quite pleasant; a mix of luxury boutiques and more standard clothing shops.
Very decent food court on the basement but also on the level 3, with lots of choices for a quick bite.
It was worthwhile if you want to spend an hour or two.
There's a MRT station that you could alight which is City Hall. There's also a link which leads to Suntec city, Marina Square and Esplanade. The food atrium of Raffles City brings you to many!
Great mall for shopping all sorts of things. Robinson’s is good and the PS Cafe is fab for brunch/lunch. Friendly staff and easy to get around.

my favourite couple of bar/restaurants outdoors while still in a mall are here with Brotziet and Marche being lovely outdoor bars great for meeting mates/business associates and people watching while having great beers

ok range of food and shops, best known for it's massive food court below

REVIEW_TITLE: Very nice but like the others
REVIEW_BODY: There are a multitude of shopping malls in Singapore & it becomes difficult to differentiate between them, this one is opposite Raffles so easy to locate & worth a look, spread across 3 floors.
The shops are spread over three floors. We went to the food hall, it was busy, hot and importantly clean. The mall is opposite Raffles hotel.

Raffles City is a landmark shopping center close the the historic Raffles Hotel, but also with two luxury hotels within the complex. You can find upmarket shops here, but also enough cafes and eateries. Not only is the basement a food paradise, on the thid floor you can find a hawkers center. Raffles City is close to Metro station City Hall, but there is also a taxi stand. Don't skip Raffles City when on a visit to Singapore.
We came here specifically to have a Singapore Sling. Part of our vacation idea. We loved our drink . lots of shopping ..not cheap for sure.
A great array of all types of shop and eating places. Helpful staff and worth a visit if only to look. We found what we went for. Lovely and airy if expensive In places.

REVIEW_TITLE: Spoilt Yourself In This Mini City
REVIEW_BODY: Raffles City is like a centrally located mini city. Two hotels, Swissotel The Stamford and Fairmont Singapore, which contains a shopping mall and City Hall MRT station, are under one roof. It does not disappoint with the large variety of local and international high-end department stores and restaurants inside this mall. However, there are also some shops and marketplace at the basement of the mall which offer budget options. Check with Information Services for any Tourist Privileges available throughout the complex. Raffles City is a great place to shop and enjoy a nice lunch /dinner. It is also a great place to catch up with friends and families. There are just too many reasons you cannot afford to miss Raffles City as a tourist or first-timer to Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: London fat duck, basement Raffles City Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The roast duck is as good as the famous London fat duck I ate many years ago in 4seasons bayswater london. Helpful service and fair prices. The black bean chilli chicken feet is the best I have eaten. The clam and scallop porridge is delicious.
Ok mall that can’t quite compete with the top ones along orchard road Anchor tenants of robinsons and supermarket/foodhall do attract some crowds. The newish designed PS cafe is nice

You can not go to Singapore without going to Raffles City. Have a s'singapore sling' in Raffles bar, watch how they make them, throw your nuts on the floor..The shopping Centre is huge and has everything you could want, put your walking shoes on tho, lots of food stores and very high end stores, you can get everything you want here

REVIEW_TITLE: From a California Girl's Perspective - Great Choice
REVIEW_BODY: Wear your walking shoes.... huge multi-story mall with everything imaginable. Prices must higher than what we're used to in the US but if there's something you need, it's probably here!! Great food and shopping choices. Good option when it's pouring down rain. Remember when you're purchasing to size up... for example, a man who wears a large shirt in the US will wear an XL here. An XL needs an XXL.... long way to return an item!! Happy Shopping!

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice shopping center with good food court
REVIEW_BODY:
As other reviewers have mentioned, there's nothing particularly exciting about Raffles City Shopping Center.

It's very clean, as is almost everything in center city Singapore.

Most of the stores are high end, as is true of many of the newer malls in the city.

It nonetheless has several favorable attributes.

These include:

A small supermarket in the basement with a good selection of products that are competitively priced. If you need drinks, snacks, fruit, etc., their prices are less than the smaller convenience stores. You can also buy prepared sandwiches.

A nice food court with a wide variety of reasonably priced options, especially for breakfast and lunch. Prices aren't as cheap as at the hawker centers, but the food court is air conditioned, you can find a table, and it's clean. Although the general stores open at 1000, many of the food stores open at 0730-0800.

Finally, the mall is next to the City Hall MRT, allowing easy access to the the East West and North South Lines.

Unfortunately, I'm writing a mall review.

You go to a mall for convenience, not for eclectic food or funky mom and pop stores.

As long as you temper your expectations, Raffles City may be worth a visit (if you're close).

REVIEW_TITLE: No different than every other shopping centres in cities
REVIEW_BODY: There is nothing special about this shopping centre, it’s lovely and clean and worth a visit if you’re within walking distance but I wouldn’t go out of my way to visit it

A very big shopping centre with plenty of shops, food court and popular brands. Its got three levels and it's separated into three combined buildings all connected into one hugh shoppers paradise. Outside is also the fountain.
Singapore has many fine showing malls and Raffles City is certainly one of them. If you are in the area to visit Raffles hotel it is worth visiting this mall.

The chocolate people make delectable ice creams also. Oh so heavenly!!! Complete bliss. We were hungry early evening and didn't want to have a meal and viola, Godiva giving ice creams and soft serve. The icing on the cake was they had an ongoing offer, buy 2 and get 1 free. Freebies always welcome.

Raffles City is large, two hotels, Swissotel The Stamford and Fairmont Singapore, and an office tower over a podium which contains a shopping complex and a convention centre, and the MRT station. If you want to indulge yourself and can afford the cost, you need go no further; local and international high-end department stores and shops, restaurants, and at the end of a tiring day be pampered in the wellness centre. Check with Information Services for any Tourist Privileges available throughout the complex. In fairness, there are a number of shops and dining establishments that will not break the bank and probably lower cost options elsewhere throughout the complex.
The London Fat Duck restaurant in Raffles city was excellent. Again, the staff were all friendly, helpful and polite. The food was delicious and plenty of it.

Raffles City is like a city in itself. Hotels, transport hub, lots of eateries and shops, all under one roof and very centrally located. When visiting Singapore it is hard to miss Raffles City or not come across it. It has a very good selection of shops across several floors, the choice of restaurants is even better. A great place to visit, shop a bit and then enjoy a nice lunch or dinner.

We love this place.. we have stayed very near it, and on top of it so always seem to gravitate to this shopping centre. Really love the bottom level with its cafes and food places, quirky stores etc
Really easy to get to and a great central spot..

Having the major interchange of underground train below it, the importance of this shopping mall cannot be underestimated. It does not disappoint with the large variety of store housed inside this upmarket mall. At basement, Nam Nam Noodle Bar and Din Tai Fung are absolute brilliant choices for lunch. There are departmental stores and high-end boutiques on upper floors too. It's entrance is also a popular place to meet your relatives or friends before moving on to other part of the city. There are just too many reasons this is the mall Singapore people and tourists can be proud of.
Maintenance of this mall is first class, given the long history of this building. Renovation after renovation to keep up with time is key.

REVIEW_TITLE: To me, best food choice in Raffles City
REVIEW_BODY: The 3rd level Food Palace in the Raffles City Mall is one of our go-to eating stops when in the CBD (central business district). The options are wide and the prices are oh so friendly. Plus if you sit near the windows you have a nice view. This was our 2nd visit to the food court, previous one in 2016. As before the restaurants in the basement are more casual, versus fast-food/casual on the 3rd level but you are then enveloped in no natural light. If we visit Singapore again we will make sure to catch a meal in the Food Palace section. On a side note, we couldn't access any free wifi in Raffles City Mall but the nearby Marina Square Mall has free wifi and is easily accessed underground past the Esplanade MRT station.

Super shopping Centre in the basement of the block occupied by the Fairmont and Swisshotel. Also direct access to the MRT station (City Hall) There is an excellent food court with a wide range of cuisine available. We weren’t “shopping” except for some light snacks and there is also a decent supermarket there too. All we needed on (under) our doorstep.
Very plush with lots of high end boutiques and shops. Able to window shop for hours!! Or Jane en enormous choice of upmarket brands. Also had interesting artworks to look at.

Huge mall with masses amounts of shopping to complete here! Big brands such as Levi’s, Timberland and Kate Spade accompany the large Robinson’s department store.

We spent two hours here browsing and taking in the size of the shopping centre. Advised if you like to shop until you drop!

REVIEW_TITLE: Always on point for F&B and shopping
REVIEW_BODY: I've been going to Raffles City for 20 years now but I must say this place has never gone out of style, whether for the young or old. Basement 1 has so many food and beverage options of all ranges and cuisines, so a tip is to buy a mix of items and enjoy them around the pretty water fountain. There are so many levels of shopping as well. Last but not least, it is extremely well connected to the transport network, located just upstairs to the City Hall MRT interchange.

REVIEW_TITLE: Mall seems to have most things
REVIEW_BODY: Arrived at our hotel, the Fairmont, in the evening and wandered around the food court under the hotel for a snack. Seems to have everything, food, chemists, supermarket and ATMs and shops. Food court seemed to be busy for lunch and dinner. Very clean as it seems everywhere is in Singapore. Also connected to the MRT.

Booked a table ( essential on a Friday and Saturday evening ) a great experience and fabulous food. All you can eat for a set fee. Must try the Chilli crab, sushi , Kobe beef, , so much variety , seafood including oysters, prawns, crayfish etc . Vibrant and busy, lots of locals, very clean and efficient . Take some wet wipes for mopping up especially the chilli crab.
Lots of luxury vendors in this very busy shopping centre. Great way to spend sometime in air conditioned comfort.
One of the many malls of Singapore. Plenty of shops, great selection of restaurants and cafés. worth visiting.
This is a mix of variety of stores for everyone. Restaurants / cafe's of different kinds. Def recommend to check it out!

REVIEW_TITLE: A gem of a food court!
REVIEW_BODY: After a long flight from Spain, a checkin and freshen up at our hotel we had to play bat & ball with body clock and find a place to eat and came across this absolute gem of a place. Now we generally think of shopping mall food halls as 'piggeries ' but this place is far and away over the usual. The vibrancy, cleanliness and quality with cost of meals make this joint a 1 stop shop! Do confuse cheap with nasty here. Need a place to eat whilst away from humid/ hot weather? Well try this joint on level 3 . We will be back.

Raffles City is something else. Shops and everything in ascending floors and at ground level, escalators to lower levels (yes underground). Down underground you will find all the eating places, Japanese, Thai, Chinese, Malay and some European. There are some other shops down there as well such as a shop selling all sorts of diaries. It isnt cheap mind

REVIEW_TITLE: Very convenient with a good range of stores
REVIEW_BODY: Centrally located and convenient to the hotel i was staying at - had such a variety of cafes and clothing and convenience stores plus what I needed, a telecom store to buy a local phone and sim card plus a camera store
Looks very clean and new, lots going on down here, especially the food court. Worth a visit and a meal.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of my favorite shopping makl
REVIEW_BODY: I like the scale of this mall, especially the Basement with its diverse eateries including Din Tai Fung. It's easy & comfortable to move around, & there is a good tenant mix. There is good accessibility via the centrally located MRT below

A great place to wander with plenty of shopping choices and food and beverage. A haven from the hot Singapore sun too, seriously effective aircon.

What impresses me most is the range of boutiques and love the artesian book binder. Check it out on the upper levels. Great personalised gift options.

Massive food court underneath gives plenty of options but there's a half decent steakhouse up top.

Raffles rocks.
Singapore is a place for shopping, high end, but shopping, and this place combines that with a very complete food court and a marketplace.

REVIEW_TITLE: A city in itself - shopping and dining paradise
REVIEW_BODY: The place is huge and just above the City Hall MRT. It holds some of the biggest brands inside the mall and some just across the street. The food options are pretty good in the basement which is open till 10-11 PM.

REVIEW_TITLE: Big mall, department store, food hall, MRT accessible
REVIEW_BODY: Big shopping mall with department store, food court, supermarket, MRT accessible but it's the City Hall station, not the Raffles Station, the food hall is great with small shops for dinning in a budget. The fashion shops are not the top brands.
Great mall for the usual but this mall includes the Raffles Supermarket & a excellent food court. Enjoyed walking around looking at unusual food & Singapore fashion.

REVIEW_TITLE: Upscale mall with great food court
REVIEW_BODY: Yet another upscale mall which Singapore has no shortage of. Convenient on the MRT and citylink walkway. Across the street from the famous raffles hotel so good location.
Not the best of shopping malls but does have a small number of up market chains. Also a M&S which does have a food offering including a reasonable selection of their wines.

I was dragged in here reluctantly by the good wife, as we were staying next door at the Fairmont Hotel. The mall is multi level and except for the restaraunt/ food court area, seemed up Market to me. Hint: The fountain at the lower area allows old guys to sit and people watch!

We forgot to pack the Aussie travellers essential item Vegemite. We search for ages and then found it in Raffles City Market Place in the Raffles City shopping centre. What a gem of a supermarket. They have got everything you could want food and drinks wise. If you like Japanese food this is the place to go. We bought some sushi and sashimi to take back to our restaurant and it was delicious. Cheese, seafood, roast chicken, Smuckers Gober peanut butter and jelly, alcohol and so much more. Prices are pretty good too. The food shops around are worth a look too. Lots of variety.

Average mall with average shops but we went 3 times just for the ice cream!! Wide variety of food available and a pharmacy which there are not as many of in Singapore - bear in mind you need your passport for some items e.g. naproxen
We stayed in the hotel above the Raffle City shopping center. A nice shopping area with a lot of brands, restaurants and shops for every occasions.

We were staying at the Carlton Hotel across the road so Raffles City was our 2nd home. Lots of shops and things to see... the MRT was right underneath the mall so we seemed to spend most of our time in Singapore going through here! Lots of fond memories.
Very christmassy with live carolling. Ambience was good. Good crowd. Many local outlet like toast box and four season bakery. Jco donuts and market place.

REVIEW_TITLE: Mall that is Linked to MRT n Hotel
REVIEW_BODY: Love this mall as it is linked to the underground MRT station, City Hall, which is also one of the interchange to reach the North, West n East of Singapore, etc. It's also attached to Swissotel. There are lots of high end retailers here and also a good number of restaurants n eateries. There's also supermarket as well. It is a pretty popular place for locals n tourists alike. It is also possible to walk to Marina Square and Esplanade from here.

Went to Raffles City to have feel of Christmas festive. Raffles City consists of hotels, shopping mall, ball rooms, meeting rooms, beverages and food.
Head to basement to have the dinner first. Went around to see what dinner to take and decided to try out Streats Asian Cafe. The foods served is just normal and nothing fantastic.
Went up to level 4 to see the indoor Christmas tree. The tree is well decorated and with performance for the children.
Overall the place is well decorated and the shops selling many festive items.
This mall is not too large but complete if you want shops (quality brands very well known) and to take a lunch (and they are very good), go to hairdresser...

Raffles City has a very impressive supermarket located at the basement, stocked with good variety of fish, cockles and crabs; organic food from around the world, such as seeds from 13 grains imported from the Mediterranean, and even eggs from New Zealand (though I wouldn't call the eggs from New Zealand fresh because of the 13 hours harvest, sterilize and transportation time). There are also wine and alcohol from countries such as Paris as well as premium snacks such as truffle potato chips.

The shopping mall is also peppered with shops retailing great variety of exclusive, collectible watches for avid collectors, as well as gifts and souvenir shops for tourist staying nearby. Not forgetting the many apparel brands for the well-to-do hippies.

For price conscious, food seeking folks, go to Esplanade MRT via the adjoining basement link and you can find a basement food court, with traditional food stall and Burger King, this is valid as at Oct 2016.

REVIEW_TITLE: Average mall. Very good foodcourt. Expensive supermarket
REVIEW_BODY: Best roast pork, BBQ duck and BBQ pork rice here. Mall was just like all the others except it has a supermarket downstairs (expensive)

We are Americans living in Shanghai, where prices for everything are high, and quality is sketch. This mall had everything we needed to enjoy our stay. We booked in Carlton Hotel, which was literally right across the street and nipped into RC each day for sundries, fresh fruits and veggies at food court market, and for hard-to-find clothing and accessories. Really a convenient place to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Shop till you drop, eat till you are satisfied
REVIEW_BODY: A premier shopping complex right in the heart of the commercial center of this vibrant city boasting so many shopping centers it is not funny. Well served by public transport and sits above City Hall MRT and gives visitors an impression that it is bigger than it really is as an underground tunnel links it to Suntec with more shopping along the way. There is a supermarket in the basement along with the food outlets in the market hall where one can satisfy one's food cravings. It has many specialty shops, local boutiques along with banks, money changers; practically everything one will need, one will find. May be a little pricier than other shopping centers due to its location and exposure as it is connected to Swissotel and bounded by Raffles, Carlton and several other hotels. To add confusion to decision making, there is more food scattered around the complex with shoppers to Robinson not having to go far for a meal and/or refreshments in the adjacent Food Court. Love it or hate it, it has survived the test of time. Take it for what it is and enjoy.

Raffles City Shopping Centre offers a huge amount of specialty stores together with Robinsons department store, Marks and Spencer's, a basement food hall which offer a large range of cuisines and takeaway meals. One of my most favourite Singapore stores, Chomel, is located here. There are a number of basement arcades leading to Sun Tec shopping centre and Marina shopping centre.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good shopping center bad costumers service attitude
REVIEW_BODY: You can find many attractive shops , and in July you will find decent discount but don't believe the center offer ( 20$ every 300$ purchase) because when I try to have my voucher the lady ignore me five minutes then in rude way asked me what I want and finally she asked my original passport despite I was carrying copy , what ?! Am I in the airport? Anyway it wasn't worth it at all I just ignored her :)

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the big nice malls within an 'underground linked' city......
REVIEW_BODY:
Just as with most big malls here, one can find 'generally' almost everything. Of course, there will be different brands, different pricing, etc.

This is a very nice mall linked to the Swissotels & across the road to the famous Raffles Hotel. Its cosy, with good ambience.

Interesting to note that Raffles City mall is linked directly underground through to the following:

1. Major nearby malls ie Suntec City, Marina Centre, Millenia Walk, Esplanade Theatre & Citylink.

2. MRT stations ( City Hall, Esplanade & Promenade stations).

Its a like an "underground city" by itself. Not surprisingly though that many tourists mistaken that this is just one super huge mall underground.

REVIEW_TITLE: Something on offer for most shopaholics.
REVIEW_BODY: A typical shopping plaza offering a wide variety of department stores and boutiques. Opened many years ago the premises have been well maintained and most retailers appeared to be holding sales. There is also a food court. For the true shopaholic there is probably greater appeal in strolling down Orchard Road where there is a far greater choice and variety of retail outlets.

A great mall, and you can walk for kilometers. You can easily get lost, but don't worry, there are heaps of signs and you can retrace your steps. Some expensive shops and some reasonably priced shops and a great food hall. Well worth the visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: This mall seems like it has almost everything
REVIEW_BODY:
Raffles City mall is plunked down on some prime property what with plenty of offices, businesses and government buildings nearby. Connected to Swissotel The Stamford hotel and across the street from Raffles Hotel and kitty-corner from Carlton Hotel, Raffles City has plenty to offer. Multiple, often confusing levels, both above and below ground. Shops of all sorts from name brand international brands to regional companies. Understand that when you are in the mall your sense of direction can be obliterated. However if you go down several levels and head south you will come upon the Esplanade MRT station whereas if you stay at ground level and venture north you will eventually come upon the City Hall MRT station. below ground are plenty of restaurants offering you a variety of cuisine including desserts, tea, and regular food. on the 3rd level, next to Robinson's, is the Food Palace that is Raffles City food court. here you will spend time figuring out what you want to consume as the choices are wide and varied and very cost-friendly. i won't discuss what we ate because there are too many options but the Food Palace, IMHO, is better than what the restaurants below ground offer. Of course not to put a wrench into anything but Raffles City also has a restaurant or two at street level with outdoor seating. So you could shop, eat and, theoretically, sleep here.
Yes, Singapore has tons of malls but since we are saying nearby Raffles City got our attention.

Convenient. Immediately upon exiting City Hall MRT, take the long ascending escalator straight ahead. At the top, you will see a Starbucks on your right, which is pretty much at the entrance of the two or three level Raffles City mall. Essentially, underneath the Fairmont and Swissotel Stamford hotels. Plenty of varied shopping and eating establishments, including Din Tai Fung. Look for the directories located around the mall so you can orient yourself and locate your destination(s), or just wander around sight seeing.

REVIEW_TITLE: Lots of dining options and shops
REVIEW_BODY:
Singapore has no shortage of malls, so as that goes this one is fine but not horribly impressive. It has more places to eat than many local malls, and a supermarket too. Shops include Coach, high end watch stores, some art galleries, dress shops, and two children's stores.

It's a good place for lunch if you're staying at the Fairmont or Swisshotel or if you need to quickly buy a gift.
Multitude of shops as well as Robinsons and a small Marks & Spencer. Lots of food options too. Conveniently located with access to MRT and hotels. Underground connections to Suntec and Esplanade.
Stopped here on way to night safari for a meal, some great sights, reminds me of Canary Wharf in London, lovely square where they all come out to eat & drink after work

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice mall with good balance between upscale and value
REVIEW_BODY: What a nice mall Basement with really nice eateries at fair prices interesting water features Robinsons dept store Good food court on higher level Well worth a visit

Just like the most of the mall in Singapore, this one is big and busy too. During there mid day and around 7PM there lines into the food places are long.

A lot of shops and stores, you can buy pretty much anything. Good selection of coffee places and snackbars.

The Suntek City is connected so you can walk around.

REVIEW_TITLE: Walk from Raffles City Suntec City
REVIEW_BODY: Raffles City connects to Suntec City Mall, a bit of a walk but better than crossing the roads. The shopping and choice of food outlets are excellent. Very busy on an evening. Just across the road from our hotel, the MRT is adjacent to Raffles City Mall, so excellent access for travelling around Singapore

Besides shopping, the Food Junction at Raffles City is excellent, clean, and reasonably priced. The variety can make choosing a meal time consuming unless you have a certain food in mind before your visit.

We always use this shopping mall as it is just a short walk from SRC. Most of the best shopping and food outlets are on the B1 floor. Ground and upwards have more specialised shopping and restaurants. Adjacent to this shopping mall is the City Hall MRT Station which provides immediate access to the N/S and E/W lines and only a short stop or two to intersect with other lines.

This shopping complex consists of variety of international brands. It consists of Robinson department store where you can find cosmetics, shoes, travel goods, electronics, clothing, etc. It's easy to get to by getting off at City Hall MRT station. Great for rainy days.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great shopping and lots of food options
REVIEW_BODY: Raffles City has many stores to choose from and a variety of restaurants. Great central location and easy access by mrt.

We stay in The Fairmont Hotel and have easy access to Raffles city. Great place to access the MRT, shops, shops and more shops. Recommend a visit to the Asian food hall on the top floor. Eat well and cheaply here. Also recommend a look at the Ode to Art gallery (#01-36E/F). Some interesting contemporary art. The Market Place at basement level offers a wide variety of foods and restaurants. Raffles city is a great place to spend time eating and browsing in air conditioned comfort.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to eat and shop
REVIEW_BODY: We stayed at the Grand Park City Hall. With a short 5 min walk above or below ground its easy reach. Food mall in the basement with restaurants on most of the floors. Plenty of shops to explore

This place is convenient if you're staying nearby and cannot be bothered to trek to one of the larger malls.
It has what you'd need if you are suddenly in the need for something casual like clothes, electronics, or a pharmacy.

Pleas give this review a thumbs up
This mall is simply awesome. Want food? Head to the basement. There is a huge department Store Robinsons. High end goods are available too like Rolex and Patek. 2 thumbs up.

Lots of shops and many food vendors. Nothing special in the way of shops...global chains. Food courts have a wide variety of choices but no pizza. Need to go elsewhere for that. Nice walk-a-bout on a rainy day.

As a consumer, I must congrats Timberland for having a team of dedicated staff at the Raffles City Branch. I was served by Brian on 24 Feb19. As a consumer and a shopper, I am very pleased and satisfied by the level of service, product knowledge and the going beyond the expected service. I bought a pair of boots for my birthday. Brian patiently attended to me and even offer to get the boots I want to be delivered to the branch since the size I fancy was not available. Nonetheless, I got a bigger size due to my wide feet. Brian offer good tips and advice on how to take care of the boots and show me the difference in the quality of the boots with and without the related care product. Not only have Brian took the effort to educate me but he also have shown me on how the care of Timberland Products can be done. I was a satisfied customer and Brian is an exemplary staff. Haven't seen such enthusiastic and dedicated sales staff in Singapore for a while. Kudos to Brian

Just to share my recent visit to a simple restaurant at Raffles City.

The set up looks clean and neat, really nothing to complain about.

The only issue I want to highlight is that the duck was not fantastic comparing with many hawker store and even foodcourt.

You are only paying for a cleaner set up with aircon condition.

This was my first visit to London fat duck

My honest opinion to the management - if you want to sell your normal food in an exorbitant pricing, you will have to make sure your food is justify for that price range.

Last but not least, I’ve tasted numerous roasted duck from many stores around Singapore, and I know exactly how big a duck drumstick portion looks like. You are shortchanging your customer by cutting a portion of meat from a drumstick ( a portion of meat was removed from the base of the drumstick as shown in the picture). The entire drumstick was meatless, mainly bone. That portion of meat being removed from my drumstick will sell to another customer.... this is something some of the hawker store are practicing awe well.

This review is to create awareness, especially to tourist out there, just need to be mindful there’s such thing happening.

Wishing all a pleasant journey, have a blessed and prosperous Lunar Chinese New Year !!!

This is a great shopping mall as it has pretty much everything but isn’t overwhelmingly huge. Lower ground is packed full of restaurants where you can get a coffee, light bite, dim sum or a full blown 3 course meal if you so desire.
Also on this level around the perimeter you will find shops including cakes & pastries, chocolates, pharmacies etc.
On the first second floors you will find a good selection of shops and also the department store Robinsons. There are more eateries on the third floor.
Lifts and escalators take you from floor to floor so suitable for disabled shoppers.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place to get food, snacks and shopping/window shopping
REVIEW_BODY: All kinds of shops and stores here. The basement has a good supermarket that you can get Sushi, roasted chicken, fruits and Alcoholic beverages to take home at decent price. Jo Malone's is my favorite. The lady staff at Jo is very informative, knowledgeable and taking her time explaining about the fragrances. Easy to get to by MRT City Hall. A good place to grab food and roam around especially on the rainy days.

This is a convenient mall situated at City Hall MRT. Food options are aplenty especially in the basement (more towards casual dining and European dining). The stores there are more upscale-oriented, expect Agnes.b, Tommy Hilfiger and the like. But on the second/third floor there are stores such as Warehouse and TOPSHOP. For ladies, I would highly recommend a store called Urban Revivo, there are always sales and very stylish clothes.
This was a boring shopping centre. Only benefit is that a lot of trains goes from here via the subway.

This is a good mall for wandering around with a wide spread of stores and eateries in the Basement.

Not too crowded and well served by a couple of MRT stations.

Have been dropping in here for the past 25 years and never disappoints even though the shops may change.

The basement area here contains a number of smaller food outlets, but the whole area can get really crowded and a little claustrophobic at lunchtime. The rest of the floors aren't as busy but equally aren't so inspiring. There's a food court at level 3 with the usual selection of standard hawker offerings at mall price levels.

I remember this mall opened in the 80s and the attached westin hotel was the tallest in asia or even the world. Now it's the swissotel and the basement of the mall underwent a dramatic and successful revamp

It's a mass market mall so no luxury brands here. There's robinson's department store and a basement supermarket

I was staying at Swissotel that’s connected to this mall.. visited Raffles City a couple of times.. it’s got most nice brands.. bought a couple of good stuff here.. excellent food stalls downstairs.. highly recommended!

Raffles City is one of the places where one can spend hours without getting bored. There are dozens of shops, a department store, a supermarket in the basement and many restaurants serving all sorts of cuisines. My favourite is the Singapore style food court on the third floor. Raffles City is very clean and well air conditioned. It can get very crowded at peak times or at weekends. Walking distances are short which makes shopping and dining really enjoyable. The Swissotel and the Fairmont Hotel are integrated into the compound and the City Hall MRT station is directly attached. Some sights like the Singapore River, the Esplanade, the Raffles Hotel and the Merlion are within walking distance. So Raffles City is a perfect place to pass by and spend some time at.
Sept. 2017 . Very big Shopping Mall with nice Shops . They are some Restaurants and Coffee-Shops with good Food and Drinks
I love this District in Singapore. This is just a stone throw from the city hall or the government seat of Singapore. The malls are spacious & got a distinct look that create a homey feeling.

I love a good mall but this one left me slightly underwhelmed.
The huge Muji store was great but the rest of the stores were just not my thing.
It was pretty quiet and felt a bit under construction. I just left feeling a bit bored with my experience.

Needed a SIM card, for local calls and the internet usage. Went to the single shop on 3rd floor. Purchased a tourist SIM for 15 dollars. Staff were very helpful and assisted with install, as I have monkey fingers. I would recommend.

It's a very large mall with plenty of stores and food vendors on site. I saw numerous stores and it was a good break in my site seeing. Also saw 5 police officers carrying plenty of fire power. So you will be safe.

Just another shopping mall, not the really special one in this case if you compared with others in Singapore. It has everything but the atmosphere is bit cool and prices are pretty high. Easy to reach with the MRT, has a stop here. It is, as many other malls, connected to the Fairmont hotel which is very nice. A few good restaurants here too.

This is one of the bigger malls around the region that houses a variety of shops selling different stuffs. There are a number of restaurants offering visitors a variety of different cuisine. This mall is located at the lower levels of the swissotel the Stamford hotel and is connected to the City Hall train station.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Food Court and Connected with the MRT
REVIEW_BODY: I went to Singapore on business in June 2016. Raffles City is connected to the MRT. There are a ton of stores but shopping is all over Singapore. The B1 level food court, however, is excellent. There is a wide variety of choices. You can also walk to Citylink and walk underground all the way to Suntec. At street level, you are not far from the Raffles Hotel and some other sights.

Raffles City is a modern shopping centre opposite the Raffles Hotel. Quite a big shopping centre I found stores that suited both my tastes and my budget. A good mid-range shopping experience handy to transport including City Hall MTR.

Very clean and easy to navigate about the mall. Lots of trendy shops and the food outlets are fine. I did not have a lot of time on my stopover and the Aussie dollar is low so the bargains are not true bargains.

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent Mall with Outstanding Food Court
REVIEW_BODY:
Located right across the street from the famous colonial Raffles Hotel and the ritzy Carlton Hotel. This mall has it all, shopping for all ages and easy access to the MRT.

I really like the elegance of the mall and its design and architecture. A large and varied food court is located on the first level down escalators.

The best mall in Singapore in my opinion.
Spent a while browsing the shops, had a bite to eat and bought a few things in one of the little supermarkets. Nice to get out of the intense humidity and browse the shops in comfort.

What I like about this mall is that it is not intimidating eventhough this is an upscale mall. They have a lot of food choices. It is also linked to the train station so very accessible. Since I stayed in Fairmont, it was easy access for me. I was able to shop and eat at this mall.

I love this shopping plaza.
Great speciality shops.
I love Kate Spade, Charles & Keith have great shoes, Marks & Spencer, Robinsons, Nine West & plenty more - high end and middle priced shops.

There is a great food court where we had lunch - noodles & sliced pork - don't be frightened to look at the pictures & order - cheap & yummy - all the local business people eat here at lunchtime.

There is also a super market in the basement which is great for supplies that your hotel charges 4 times the price for. And Verve is the same price as at home in Melb $65.
Get your drinks / chip & dip here too.

Lots of other places to buy food - well worth a look around.

One of my favourite Malls in Singapore.

It is attached to the Stamford hotel - where we stayed.

I came here to see an art exhibition at Ode de Art gallery inside the mall. The exhibition was great!
This is another big mall in Singapore, which connects to two hotels and with a range of food choices. I came from Hong Kong, we have a lot of malls too. It's nice to come in for the air-con if you are all sweaty. It was also nice for me to see shops that I don't see in Hong Kong. I wouldn't say this mall is particularly interesting or attractive, but the location is good and it connects to the MRT.

REVIEW_TITLE: Something else more than the Excellency
REVIEW_BODY: Something else more than the Excellency This time i came to by some cosmetics from Robinson nice Mall no changes from last year desrve the visit

Raffles city is a very quant mall very central to major hotels and convention center. The selection of stores and restaurants including fast food is so vast. Its another option for shopping if you like to avoid the overcrowded Orchard area. Clean and easy to go around as well.

The Raffles city with its lots of restaurants and shops has a super location in the middle of the city. You can spend there hours for shopping or having some food. There is also a huge food court, supermarket and drugstore in the basement. It is also a stop from the Hop on Hop off bus.
The mall had numerous store, from luxury to mid-ranged brands. A great place for a short stroll or quick gift.

REVIEW_TITLE: Average mall but variety of food outstanding
REVIEW_BODY: The mall is good - not as posh as Orchard street malls - but offers an excellent choice of food - restaurants and shops - on the lower level. The rea benefit is the connection to the convention center and to the Fairmont hotel.
This mall is right next door to the Swissotel. It's good great restaurants and shops. Lots of the big brands are in this mall. Would go here again. Great cakes in the basement.

This is one of many malls you will find in this shopping mall of a city...
Same names, same shops, same everything!
If you like shopping then Singapore is for you with its characterless repeated malls everywhere.
Value has diminished with the strength of SGD now
This is a famous place here.Lots locals and tourists.A good selection of shops.They have a variety of food out lets here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Always a good place to go
REVIEW_BODY:
Raffles City has been around for many years but it still feels very new. The mall has been well maintained and constantly being upgraded. There are many shops here selling clothing, accessories, etc.

The mall is spacious and pleasant to walk around even though there are many people shopping here. The City Hall MRT station is below, which makes this mall very accessible.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good Mall in the heart of the city.
REVIEW_BODY:
Raffles City Mall opened in 1986 by world-renowned architect I M Pei just opposite St. Andrew's Cathedral. And Mall design still remains modern.
Raffles City Mall located on 1, 2, 3 floors where located over 200 specialty shops.
Raffles City Mall is well integrated into the Raffles City Tower office building, Raffles City Convention Center and hotels: Swissotel The Stamford and Fairmont Singapore. There are also two supermarkets here.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the better malls in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Ok to its a shopping mall so full of the usual brands. But I think this is one of the better malls in Singapore. It’s well laid out and easy to find your way around. Good variety of shops and a v good food court. Easily linked with the MRT underneath and close to a good handful of hotels / opposite Raffles and next door to The Fairmont, The Swissotel and close to JW Marriott. The department store - Robinson’s- is very good.
We’ve validated several times for a shopping trip over the years. It has quite a few well known brand and designer stores. It’s a clean and tidy shopping center. Doesn’t ever seem to be overly busy.

REVIEW_TITLE: Never mind the shopping; check out the sculptures!
REVIEW_BODY: Before / after your retail therapy, be sure to check out the sculptures in Raffles Plaza! Along the Quay there's the very famous Divng Boys sculpture; half a dozen pre-teen laddies 'diving' into the Singapore River in the nuddy. A few metres away is Bird; a scuplture by Botero. Where else in the world can you touch a Botero original??????? And walk just a few more metres from Bird to see Homage to Newton by Salvador Dali. Personally I think the Singapore government wasted their money on this one... S Dali should have stuck to paintings! But it's quite exciting for art lovers to come up close & personal to a real Botero!!! And the Diving Boys is quite sweet & nostalgic (a bye-gone era!)

REVIEW_TITLE: A very good mall for shopping, time pass and food
REVIEW_BODY: A very beautiful and busy mall. So many luxury and regular brands availabile. Very good for leisure time as well as shopping. Food outlets carry something for everyone's taste. The mall design is great.
Numerous outlets to choose from. Shoppers mecca close to Raffles Hotel. Plenty of places to eat/coffee stops. Well worth a visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: You can find most things here
REVIEW_BODY: So this really is almost as city with 2 hotels attached and a convention centre and with 2 MRT stations and very central. There is something for everyone from high end shops to high street brands including mango and jack wills, COD, coach , desigual, Shanghai Tang, British India, Aldo. There are many beauty and wellness stores like Jo Malone , occtaigne. There are local brands. There is a large Robinsons department store. Speciality stores like nespresso. A lovely supermarket raffles city market place. Lots of options for food from a food court upstairs and in the basement and McDonalds and Subway too. Local cuisine as well as European food in PS Cafe. Taxi tanks outside too. So much to see and do and lovely and air conditioned too. They also have events on.

I had dinner with old friends on 7 Sep. Food not bad. Ambience good and convenient at city hall mrt. No booking required can walk in but quite crowded. They have a few specialties dishes and were good..fried bee hoon, yam and bun. Putien has quite a few branches around neighbourhood areas. Can go lah!

I went here by grab car from Marina Parade. It was about SGD14. Came here because I had to go to the National Gallery Singapore. It's a shopping mall like others, nice for window shopping, but the food court is great with various choices. So we had chinese dessert, fish noodle soup, deep fried pork and grilled duck. Yummeyy

This is just another ubiquitous shopping complex but the food court or hawker centre is fantastic. There are dozens of different food outlets with a variety of cuisines and most of it is freshly cooked whilst you wait. Prices are a fraction of what you would pay in a so called "proper" restaurant in this city and the atmosphere is buzzing with a mix of locals and tourists. Just find somewhere to sit and enjoy.
We had lunch and cold beers and still had change from half a crown!!

With a name like Raffles you would have to good. Directly opposite Raffles it is delightful and well appointed shopping centre with as you would expect all the biggest and best quality retailers, however they are everywhere in the few Hundred or so shopping Centres that is Singapore, however the food halls are fantastic , , standout quality and presentation
A general Singapore shopping mall. Most of the shops here are general shops and brands which can be found in pretty much all the malls in Singapore. Closest MRT is city hall.

Well located in the heart of the city with everything at your disposal. Nice clean modern shopping mall with food and high end stores all under the one roof, across from Raffles Hotel in centre of town. Recommended.

What I like this place most is even raining no need umbrella from where I stayed for this visit. Another reason, once go this place almost everything is here. Don't need to go for other place. As for me this place is just nice for short trip. I cannot wait coming back again!!
Very colourful, busy place to visit. The shopping here is amazing and good quality stuff. Very clean placea nd roads.

This is what I'd describe as a normal shopping centre with an array of shops and cafes. Unlike the centre at the marina bay sands, raffles city has high street brands and there are a number of coffees shops for a break. Ideal if your staying at the Fairmount

This central mall houses every style of shop imaginable so it doesn't matter if you're looking for gifts, food, clothes or beauty, head here. It might not be the cheapest but on a hot day in Singapore, it's the coolest!
